sub_topic: Determining the length of a diagonal in a rectangular prism.
message_1: A rectangular prism has dimensions 6 cm × 8 cm × 10 cm. Find the length of the diagonal of the rectangular prism.
message_2:
To find the length of the diagonal of a rectangular prism, we can use the 3D Pythagorean theorem. If the dimensions of the rectangular prism are a, b, and c, and the diagonal is d, then the formula is:

d = √(a² + b² + c²)

In this case, a = 6 cm, b = 8 cm, and c = 10 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

d = √(6² + 8² + 10²)
d = √(36 + 64 + 100)
d = √(200)

The length of the diagonal of the rectangular prism is √(200) cm, which can be simplified to 10√(2) cm.
